description: Danny Willett was due to tee off at 8:11am local time at the Arnold Palmer Invitational at Bay Hill, but pulled out due to illness and was replaced in the field by American Blayne Barber.
title: Danny Willett withdraws from Arnold Palmer Invitational
title_page: Danny Willett withdraws from Arnold Palmer Invitational | Daily Mail Online
text:
Danny Willett has withdrawn from the Arnold Palmer Invitational, just three weeks before the defence of his Masters title at Augusta National.
Willett was due to tee off at 8:11am local time at Bay Hill, but pulled out due to illness and was replaced in the field by American Blayne Barber.
The world number 14 will now have just one tournament, next week's WGC-Dell Technologies Match Play in Texas, to find some form ahead of the year's first major championship.
Danny Willett's Masters preparations have hit a wall as he withdrew from Bay Hill due to illness
American Blayne Barber replaced Willett in the field at the Arnold Palmer Invitational
Willett was fifth in the Maybank Championship in February after failing to convert a three-shot 54-hole lead.
But then missed the cut in the Honda Classic and was 69th in a 77-man field in the WGC-Mexico Championship.
However, the 29-year-old will be hoping to offer a strong title defence at the Masters at the beginning of April after winning in remarkable fashion last year.
Willett claimed a shock Masters win with a superb five-under-par on the final day as overnight leader Jordan Spieth crumbled during a thrilling last round.
